Questions: Control charts show:
C: Common cause and special cause variation
D: Different types of variation depending on the type of process

Questions:
A stable process has only common cause variation. A control chart depicts non random variation via:
I. Points lying outside the control limits
II. Points lying outside the specification limits
III. Sudden shifts in averages
5 phones are checked from every production lot and are categorized as defective or nondefective. Which control chart will you use to analyse that the process is in control:
Choose the INCORRECT statement:

A Team Leader performs random spot checks on the order forms completed by his team members and counts the number of defects per form. He completes as many checks every day as his schedule allows. Which control chart can be used to assess whether the process is in control:
Which of the following activity is NOT done post plotting a control chart:
C: Take actions to prevent the assignable causes in future

Questions:
Which if the following indicate the purpose of putting a control plan in place:
I. Determine the plan to maintain the Xs
II. Ensure that the process is well documented
III. Outline corrective actions
IV. Ensure communication and training to the people who run the process
Documenting of solutions, benefits and lessons learnt serves what purpose:
A: The solution can be easily replicated in similar areas while avoiding any pitfalls
B: Management can win awards basis the documentation
C: It eliminates the need for any audits

Questions: In control phase, to ensure sustenance of improved performance, ongoing evaluation includes
A: Continuing to meet with the project team after the handover to process owner is complete
C: Starting a new DMAIC project in the subsequent year

A: Be validated by an unbiased financial expert
B: Indicate projected hard benefits which will be monitored for at least period of 1 year

A: Identify if a process has common causes
